description: Brain-Computer Interface frontier models — emerging technology with LOW confidence

model_cards.name: Medical Brain-Computer Interface Platform
model_cards.one_liner: FDA-pathway neural interface platform for paralysis rehabilitation, locked-in syndrome communication, and prosthetic control — hardware+software+clinical trials vertically integrated.
model_cards.sector_name: Navigational, Measuring, Electromedical, and Control Instruments Manufacturing
model_cards.deep_dive_evidence: Neuralink N1 implant received FDA Breakthrough Device Designation (2023). BrainGate clinical trials show 95% cursor control accuracy for paralyzed patients. Total spinal cord injury population ~300K in US. Aging population increases stroke-related paralysis cases. BCI market projected $3.7B by 2030 (Grand View Research).
falsification_criteria: FDA rejects or significantly delays BCI device approval pathways beyond 2029
Non-invasive BCI alternatives achieve comparable signal resolution to implanted electrodes
Major adverse event in clinical trial triggers industry-wide regulatory freeze

model_cards.name: Consumer Neurotechnology Accessibility Platform
model_cards.one_liner: Non-invasive EEG-based interface platform enabling motor-impaired users to control devices, communicate, and navigate digital environments — mass-market accessibility infrastructure.
model_cards.sector_name: Navigational, Measuring, Electromedical, and Control Instruments Manufacturing
model_cards.deep_dive_evidence: Non-invasive EEG headsets declining in cost (Emotiv EPOC X at $849, OpenBCI at $399). ADA compliance requirements expanding to digital interfaces. WHO estimates 1.3B people globally with significant disabilities. Consumer EEG accuracy improving but still limited vs invasive (70% vs 95% classification). Kernel Flow and NextMind (acquired by Snap) demonstrate consumer interest.
falsification_criteria: Non-invasive EEG classification accuracy plateaus below 85% for consumer-grade hardware
Major tech platforms (Apple, Google) build accessibility BCI features natively into devices
Consumer adoption rate remains below 0.1% of disability population after 3 years

model_cards.name: Cognitive Augmentation Workspace
model_cards.one_liner: Neural-sensing productivity platform that monitors cognitive states (focus, fatigue, stress) via non-invasive wearables and optimizes work environment, task scheduling, and team coordination in real-time.
model_cards.sector_name: Computer Systems Design and Related Services
model_cards.deep_dive_evidence: Kernel Flow demonstrated high-density non-invasive neural imaging ($50K device). Muse, Neurosity (Crown headband) targeting consumer focus tracking. Workplace productivity software market $47B. Major adoption barriers: privacy concerns (brain data), accuracy of non-invasive sensing, employee acceptance. No evidence of enterprise adoption beyond wellness programs.
falsification_criteria: Employee resistance to workplace neural monitoring prevents enterprise adoption for 5+ years
Non-invasive cognitive state classification fails to exceed 75% accuracy in real-world office conditions
Privacy regulation (GDPR, state laws) explicitly bans or severely restricts workplace neural data collection

model_cards.name: BCI Signal Processing Infrastructure
model_cards.one_liner: Cloud infrastructure for neural signal processing — real-time decoding, noise reduction, and intent classification APIs that BCI device manufacturers build on instead of developing in-house.
model_cards.sector_name: Computer Systems Design and Related Services
model_cards.deep_dive_evidence: BCI signal processing is the bottleneck — every BCI company builds proprietary decoders. Neural data is high-dimensional (256+ channels, 1kHz+ sampling). Cloud processing enables model sharing and transfer learning across patients. Open-source frameworks (MNE-Python, BCI2000) demonstrate demand for shared infrastructure. Data moat: neural signal patterns compound across users.
falsification_criteria: BCI device manufacturers insist on on-device processing for latency and privacy, making cloud APIs irrelevant
Open-source neural decoding models achieve parity with proprietary infrastructure within 2 years
Total BCI device market remains below $1B through 2030, insufficient to support infrastructure layer
